Package com.github.kaktushose.jda.commands.dispatching.reply

Interface Replyable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ButtonEvent, CommandEvent
    public interface Replyable
    Generic interface holding reply methods.
    Since:
    2.3.0
    Version:
    4.0.0
    Author:
    Kaktushose

    • Method Detail

      • reply

        default void reply​(@NotNull
                   @NotNull String message)
        Sends a message to the TextChannel where the interaction was executed.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to send

      • reply

        default void reply​(@NotNull
                   @NotNull String format,
                   @NotNull
                   @NotNull Object... args)
        Sends a formatted message using the specified format string and arguments to the TextChannel where the interaction was executed.
        Parameters:
        format - the message to send
        args - Arguments referenced by the format specifiers in the format string. If there are more arguments than format specifiers, the extra arguments are ignored. The number of arguments is variable and may be zero.
        Throws:
        IllegalFormatException - If a format string contains an illegal syntax, a format specifier that is incompatible with the given arguments, insufficient arguments given the format string, or other illegal conditions.

      • reply

        default void reply​(@NotNull
                   @NotNull net.dv8tion.jda.api.utils.messages.MessageCreateData message)
        Sends a message to the TextChannel where the interaction was executed.
        Parameters:
        message - the Message to send

        Parameters:

      • reply

        default void reply​(@NotNull
                   @NotNull String message,
                   @Nullable
                   @Nullable Consumer<net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message> success)
        Sends a message to the TextChannel where the interaction was executed. This method also allows to access the JDA RestAction consumer.
        Parameters:
        message - the String message to send
        success - the JDA RestAction success consumer
        See Also:
        JDA RestAction Documentation

      • with

        Replyable with​(@NotNull
               @NotNull Component... components)
        Adds an ActionRow to the reply and adds the passed Components to it. For buttons, they must be defined in the same Interaction as the referring Command.
        Parameters:
        components - the Components to add
        Returns:
        the current instance for fluent interface

      • withButtons

        default Replyable withButtons​(@NotNull
                              @NotNull String... buttons)
        Adds an ActionRow to the reply and adds the passed Components to it. The buttons must be defined in the same Interaction as the referring Command. This will enable all buttons. To add disabled buttons, use with(Component...).
        Parameters:
        buttons - the id of the buttons to add
        Returns:
        the current instance for fluent interface

      • setEphemeral

        default Replyable setEphemeral​(boolean ephemeral)
        Whether to send ephemeral replies.
        Parameters:
        ephemeral - true if replies should be ephemeral
        Returns:
        the current instance for fluent interface

      • editReply

        default Replyable editReply​(boolean edit)
        Whether this reply should edit the existing message or send a new one. The default value is true.
        Parameters:
        edit - true if this reply should edit the existing message
        Returns:
        the current instance for fluent interface

      • keepComponents

        default Replyable keepComponents​(boolean keep)
        Whether this reply should keep all components that are attached to the previous message. The default value is true.
        Parameters:
        keep - true if this reply should keep all components
        Returns:
        the current instance for fluent interface

      • reply

        default void reply​(Consumer<net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message> success)
        Sends the reply to Discord. Use this if you only want to edit components or if you have constructed the reply message by using getReplyContext(). This method also allows to access the JDA RestAction consumer.
        Parameters:
        success - the JDA RestAction success consumer

      • reply

        default void reply​(Consumer<net.dv8tion.jda.api.entities.Message> success,
                   Consumer<Throwable> failure)
        Sends the reply to Discord. Use this if you only want to edit components or if you have constructed the reply message by using getReplyContext(). This method also allows to access the JDA RestAction consumer.
        Parameters:
        success - the JDA RestAction success consumer
        failure - the JDA RestAction failure consumer

      • removeComponents

        default void removeComponents()
        Removes all components from the last message that was sent. This will only work with editReply(boolean) set to true.

      • reply

        void reply()
        Sends the reply to Discord. Use this if you only want to edit components or if you have constructed the reply message by using getReplyContext().

      • getReplyContext

        @NotNull
@NotNull ReplyContext getReplyContext()
        Gets the ReplyContext to use.
        Returns:
        the ReplyContext
